data.name: 0001 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: How about you stand up before you start grumbling about this and that?

data.name: 0002 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: R-right.

data.name: 0003 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Well, did you find the man-eating classroom in the end?

data.name: 0004 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Well, that's…

data.name: 0005 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: There's no way I can tell her the truth.

data.name: 0006 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: On the other hand, it doesn't look like Haruhi will be satisfied with nothing…

data.name: 0007 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Hello? How did it go?

data.name: 0008 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Ah, unfortunatly we got nothing.

data.name: 0009 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What…?

data.name: 0010 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: You could plainly see her complexion changing…

data.name: 0012 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Us as well. We carried out the most thorough investigation we could, but…

data.name: 0013 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Unfortunately, there were few clues to be found.

data.name: 0014 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Rather, there probably shouldn't have been any way for us to find clues in the first place.

data.name: 0015 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What do you mean, Koizumi?

data.name: 0016 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: For example, what if this were a mere mistake?

data.name: 0017 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: In the first place, there's only one person who claimed to have seen it.

data.name: 0018 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: The computer society member, huh.

data.name: 0019 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Indeed. We're not in a comfortable position to deny…

data.name: 0020 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: …that the event exists only within that one person's head, don't you think?

data.name: 0021 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What are you trying to say exactly?

data.name: 0022 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: If he were confused or misguided…

data.name: 0023 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: …it wouldn't be surprising that we're unable to find a trace or any evidence.

data.name: 0024 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: That's certainly a sound argument, but how dare you put it so bluntly.

data.name: 0025 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I thought you said it wasn't in Haruhi's nature to be persuaded by words?

data.name: 0026 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Well, certainly you have a point…

data.name: 0027 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What do you think, Mikuru?

data.name: 0029 (386.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Huh? M-me?

data.name: 0030 (386.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Hmm… I guess so… It could be like that, I think…

data.name: 0031 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: No no, now's the time to be more assertive, Asahina.

data.name: 0032 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Now you mention it, those guys have been working all nighters here for a while, right?

data.name: 0033 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What about it?

data.name: 0034 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Maybe they started seeing things due to lack of sleep?

data.name: 0035 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Humans instinctively try to escape from painful or difficult things.

data.name: 0036 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Seeing things or hearing things are the prime examples of that don't you think?

data.name: 0037 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: A "Phantom Classroom" sounds like a perfect symbol of escaping reality.

data.name: 0038 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Hmm…

data.name: 0039 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Looks like she's not quite buying it.

data.name: 0040 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Say, Nagato. Don't you think that kind of hallucination is fairly normal?

data.name: 0043 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Ugh, was handing over to Nagato a mistake?

data.name: 0044 (386.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Staring at a monitor for extended time perio- ds is a burden on the eyeball and optic nerve.

data.name: 0045 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Th-that's right. Exactly. Those guys have been at computers the whole time, right?

data.name: 0046 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: With all these various causes, the misunders- tanding explation makes a lot of sense, right?

data.name: 0047 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: With Nagato's great assist coming out of left field, I pressed for Haruhi's verdict.

data.name: 0048 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Guh… I guess. That could be right.

data.name: 0049 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Phew…

data.name: 0050 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It was a pretty poor explanation, but she seemed to have somewhat accepted it.

data.name: 0051 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: For goodness sake, hallucinating from tiredness? I've had enough of false alarms!

data.name: 0052 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I'd better barge in to the computer society and have a go at them.

data.name: 0053 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I guess I can't help it if you want to pour salt on their tired wounds.

data.name: 0054 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Why don't you do it when they're in a better condition though?

data.name: 0055 (386.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What are you talking about? Striking your enemy when they're weak is just logical!

data.name: 0056 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Sorry, computer society. I hope you don't mind taking one for world peace here.

data.name: 0059 (386.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: You look rather tired.

data.name: 0060 (386.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Because I am rather tired.

data.name: 0061 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I need to find the right timing to put an end to this training camp…

data.name: 0062 (386.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Looks like this is going to be a summer I won't forget—in good and bad ways.

data.name: 0063 (386.ja) INFO (CHOICE)
data.value: About Haruhi
